Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.title: API Request: Getting the correct indentation level of a line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
For https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/1017, we need to be able to move the cursor to the correct indentation level.

We can't just insert a tab, because when the cursor is at the beginning of the line, there's no way to know whether we should insert a tab or not.

Alternatively, an API call that indents the current line to the correct level would also be suitable for our purposes.

data.title: Issue with link highlighting in mardown files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|bracket-pair-colorizer|CoenraadS|0.10.3|
|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.1.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.3|
|LogFileHighlighter|emilast|1.1.1|
|tabsanity|jedmao|0.0.9|
|docomment|k--kato|0.0.14|
|vscode-rust|kalitaalexey|0.3.14|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.5|
|better-merge|pprice|0.7.0|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.12.1|
|java|redhat|0.2.1|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add `[good](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb613488(v=vs.85).aspx)` to a text file.
2. Observe that the link is highlighted correctly and loads the correct page when clicked.
3. Add `[bad](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb613488(v=vs.85).aspx)` to a markdown file.
4. Observe that the link stops highlighting after the `vs.85` and loads the wrong page when clicked.

The code `[this works](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb613488(v=vs.85).aspx)` loads the correct link in Github, so it's not invalid markdown (or it's not invalid globally, at least). [this works](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb613488(v=vs.85).aspx)

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/25690493/d03d7932-3046-11e7-9b01-3ee5aeb1b7ba.PNG)

data.title: When tasks.json created the first time, restart is required to make it work
data.body:
Repro steps.
1) Open vcode in a new directory with some source file, say, main.cpp
2) Press: CTRL-SHIFT-B, you will be prompted to create tasks.json
3) Add "isBuildCommand":true and add some command, say, make
4) Press: CTRL-SHIFT-B again, same response as in step 2)

Workaround, close VSCode, open it again.

data.title: "format code" on .aspx/.jsp file results in unnecessary indents
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.11.2
- OS Version:Windows 10 1703

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Create a `test.aspx` or `test.jsp` file with the following content 
```
<%@Master language="C#"%>
<%@Register TagPrefix="a" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
<%@Register TagPrefix="b" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
<%@Register TagPrefix="c" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html><some-content /></html>
```
2. Right click and "format document". This will result in: 
```
<%@Master language="C#"%>
    <%@Register TagPrefix="a" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
        <%@Register TagPrefix="b" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
            <%@Register TagPrefix="c" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
                <!DOCTYPE html>
                <html>
                <some-content />

                </html>
```

**Expected outcome**:
```
<%@Master language="C#"%>
<%@Register TagPrefix="a" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
<%@Register TagPrefix="b" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
<%@Register TagPrefix="c" Namespace="a" Assembly="a"%>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<some-content />

</html>
```

**Suggested solution:** When no closing tag is found, treat server directive tags (`<%@ %>`) as if they were self closing (`<%@ %/>`), or as if they were comments.

**Resources:**

* Directives for ASP(X) https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/xz702w3e(v=vs.100).aspx
* Directives for JSP http://beginnersbook.com/2013/05/jsp-tutorial-directives/

data.title: Git Commit All for single directory.
data.body:
It would be really nice to be able to be in the explorer, right click a directory and create a git commit for just the changes in that directory. 

The specific scenario I'm thinking about is with WordPress, where you might have your entire deployment in a repo. I do this for local testing to make sure that everything works and then I deploy the updated plugins. 
 
I may at the same time update WordPress core if I feel like there is some issue with a plugin update that may be resolved by having the latest core. 

So you have this giant commit of all of these changes you made. While it might not be important. I think it would be nice to have tooling that allows you to easily do commits for individual directories. That way if you want to commit plugin updates for individual plugins as separate named commits you can. 

The built-in git I didn't dig into very far but it seems to just want to do your whole working space and not encourage much in the way of clean commits.

I'm sure I can find another way to do this, but since I like vscode and it seems like a good feature I thought I would mention it. :)

data.title: Continue Investigation of checkJS in HTML Files
data.body:
Follow up on https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25809

VSCode 1.13 insiders should now support `// @ts-check` in html files. However, there are a few issues with the current implementation

* It applies to all script blocks in a html file
* `//  @ts-check` must be on the first line of the first script block in a html file
* We do not observe the `"javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs"` setting in html files

data.title: Add git delete branch command
data.body:
This implements https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2558

![vscode-delete-branch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/530988/25683650/1882d904-3055-11e7-8fee-ca8fbc932ea5.gif)

This is my first contribution, so the approach I took in implementing it is probably quite naive. I'm looking forward to comments and suggestions on how to improve the code. Some things I wasn't sure about:

- This only implements deleting regular branches, not the remote branches, nor tags. Should those cases be handled as well? I have the feeling that removing remote branches should be handled automatically by regular purges.
- I'm excluding the currently checked out branch from the list of branches to delete. For that, I used `const currentHead = this.model.HEAD && this.model.HEAD.name;` and then filtering by `ref.name !== currentHead`. I'm not sure if `this.model.HEAD` is the right way to get the current branch.
- I have `const placeHolder = 'Select a branch to delete';` but saw that other strings for prompts use `localize(...)`. However, in the `git.checkout` command there is also such a `placeHolder` constant which does not use `localize` so I wasn't sure here.
- In `git/src/model.ts` there is that weird `Operation` enum with bit shifting for the values. I haven't understood what the exact purpose of that is, so I just followed the pattern and added a new entry at the end.

data.title: Detect Markdown Reference Link Block Entries as Links
data.body:
**Feature Request**
For the markdown:

```markdown
[autosave]: /docs/editor/codebasics.md#saveauto-save
```

Detect `/docs/editor/codebasics.md#saveauto-save` as a link in the editor

data.title: Add "Include" to extension TSConfig Files
data.body:
**Bug**
Most VSCode extensions currently specify `"exclude"` in their `tsconfig.json` but not `"include"`. This may result in extra files being included in each project

**Fix**
Add  `"include": ["src/**/*"]` to all extension tsconfig files

data.title: Use Shared TypeScript to Compile VSCode Colorizer Tests
data.body:
**Bug**
Colorizer-tests currently installs an old version of typescript

**Fix**
Switch to using the standard typescript that all other extensions use.

data.title: Can't drag a file over a Markdown preview in another editor group
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an Markdown file, then Markdown: Open Preview to the Side (Ctrl+K V)
2. Now try to drag a file over to the editor group with the Markdown preview.

The drop icon appears but the file is not moved after the drop.

data.title: Add git.commitType configuration
data.body:
This controls what happens when committing with nothing staged
It has options for committing all files, committing just tracked fiels
or not committing.

data.title: Can't drag Markdown preview to start a new editor group
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 7, 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. With a single editor group, open a Markdown file, then Markdown: Open Preview (Ctrl+Shift+V)
2. Now try to drag the markdown preview to the side to start a new editor group

The drop is blocked.

If you select another file and then try to drag the markdown preview with only the tabbed heading, it works.

data.title: VSC will hang when focus is returned in some occasions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.x
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Visual Studio Code
2. Open a file
3. Put focus to another window
4. Return focus to Visual Studio Code
5. VSC will hang for a certain amount of time

This issue has so far only occured for me with Code 1.11, it is guinely frustrating to switch focus to another window, then come back only for the editor to not respond. The duration of this hang differs every time and this doesn't always happen either.

data.title: Improper URL unescape when clicking link
data.body:
Hello Support,

When clicking a link in VSCode, the URL is incorrectly unescaped prior to handing the request to the browser.  

Example URL pasted into VSCode:
http://www.test.com/path/service?authId=CN%3DQ10

Result - the '%3D' is unescaped to '=' when you Ctrl-Click:
GET /path/service?authId=CN=Q10 HTTP/1.1

Please review and correct.

Regards,
Jeff Woehler


- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)

data.title: Enable Semantic Diagnostics for Inline JS
data.body:
Fixes #25809

**Bug**
Inline js in html currently only reports syntax errors. This means that `// @ts-check` does not work to help catch programming errors

**Fix**
Also report semantic errors in script tags

**Risk**
This may result in many more errors being reported in script tags, possibly incorrectly. `ts-check` is not enabled by default however, you must opt the file into it
